column4: hi does anybody know if i can change the colour of my screenname in Pidgin conversations? It's clashing with my GTK2 theme. Much appreciated!
hold on a second
thank you :)
ok, try clicking Tools -> Plugins
i've been all through there. i found one plugin that changed my conversation text, but not my screenname text.
crud.  I could've SWORN the color changer was there.
but yeah, you're right.
perhaps there is another plugin to accomplish this, i'll look further. thanks anyways man.
be careful installing that.
why is that?
it depends on the license for it, and I'm sure that if your mom's company finds out, it could get her fired.
it's okay, they gave her her own license for it. it's not a group license. also, they terminated her contract illegally, so they can suck my left nut.
all right then!  LoL  Nice snag on your part, in that case.
mmhrmm. and she managed to heist adobe acrobat professional too lol.
then set up your themes in /root/.themes differently.
it doesn't seem to persist.
log in as root (i know it's bad, but it will accomplish what you want), then set up your themes, log out, and never log in as root again!
again, I did that and it STILL doesn't persist.  That's what's bothering me.
i'm just content soft linking my ~/.themes to /root/.themes. why isn't that good enough?
I like the visual reminder that I'm running a program with admin privileges.  It'd just be nice to have something other than that gray.
meh, I know it's overkill but it'd be nice.
